content: उपद्रवः {@--1@} An unhappy accident, misfortune, calamity. {@--2@} Injury, trouble, harm; पुंसामसमर्थानामुपद्रवायात्मनो भवेत्कोपः <ls>Pt. 1. 324</ls>; निरुपद्रवं स्थानं <ls>Pt. 1.</ls> {@--3@} Outrage, violence. {@--4@} A national distress (whether caused by the king or famine, seasons &c.). {@--5@} A national disturbance, rebellion. {@--6@} A symptom, a supervenient disease (one brought on whilst a person is suffering from another).
